js.user
Class JsAttr

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<JsObject>
          js.core.JsObject
              js.dom.DOM2Core.Node.Prototype
                  js.user.JsNode
                      js.dom.DOM2Core.Attr.Prototype
                          js.user.JsAttr
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectLike
public class JsAttr
extends DOM2Core.Attr.Prototype

An opaque class representing JavaScript client-side objects of the global JsClient.Attr class.

An object of this opaque class represents an attribute of an JsElement node. Objects of this opaque class are associated with JsElement nodes but are not directly part of the document tree (and have a null JsNode.parentNode property. You can obtain an JsAttr object through the JsNode.attributes property or by calling the JsElement.getAttributeNode(String) or JsElement.getAttributeNodeNS(String, String) methods.

The value of an attribute is represented by the descendant nodes of a node of this opaque class. In HTML documents, a node of this opaque class always has a single Text node child, and the value property provides a shortcut for reading and writing the value of this child node.

The XML grammar allows XML documents to have attributes that consist of Text nodes and EntityReference nodes, which is why an attribute value cannot be fully represented by a string. In practice, however, web browsers expand any entity references in XML attribute values and do not implement the EntityReference interface. Therefore, in client-side JavaScript, the value property is all that is needed to read and write attribute values.

Since attribute values can be completely represented by strings, it is not usually necessary to use this opaque class at all. In most cases, the easiest way to work with attributes is with the JsElement.getAttribute(String) and JsElement.setAttribute(String, Object) methods. These methods use strings for attribute values and avoid the use of this class altogether.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. The checkcast operation to the class literal of this interface must be ignored and instanceof to it always true.

Field Detail

name

public static final Value.String.Member name

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsAttr node refers to a read-only string value which is the name of the attribute.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

value

public static final Value.String.Member value

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsAttr node refers to the value of the attribute. When reading the property, the attribute value is returned as a string. When you set the property to a string, it automatically creates a JsText node that contains the same text and makes that JsText node the sole child of the JsAttr node.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

ownerElement

public static final JsElement.Member ownerElement

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsAttr node is a read-only reference to a JsElement object that contains the attribute, or null if the JsAttr node is not currently associated with any JsElement node.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

specified

public static final Value.Boolean.Member specified

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsAttr node is a read-only reference to a JsElement object that contains the attribute, or null if the JsAttr node is not currently associated with any JsElement node.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

var

public final JsElement var(JsElement.Member r)

cloneNode

public JsAttr cloneNode(java.lang.Boolean deep)
Description copied from class: JsNode

Makes a copy of this node, or of the node and all its descendants.

This method makes and returns a copy of the node on which it is called. If passed the argument true, it recursively clones all descendants of the node as well. Otherwise, it clones only the node and none of its children. The returned node is not part of the document tree, and its JsNode.parentNode property is null. When a JsElement node is cloned, all of its attributes are also cloned. Note, however, that event listener functions registered on a node are not cloned.

Overrides:
cloneNode in class JsNode
Parameters:
deep - true to clone recursively all descendants of the node; Otherwise, clone only this node.
Returns:
A copy of this node.
See Also:
JsNode.cloneNode(JsBoolean), JsNode.cloneNode(Value)

cloneNode
